title: WHIG Systematically Withholds Contradictory Intelligence from Congress
summary: In the critical lead-up to the Iraq authorization vote, the White House Iraq Group (WHIG) systematically withholds intelligence reports that contradict administration claims about Iraqi WMD programs and terrorist connections. Congressional intelligence committees receive only carefully cherry-picked intelligence supporting the war narrative.
description: The White House Iraq Group, a coordinated effort led by Karl Rove and established by Chief of Staff Andrew Card, deliberately manipulated intelligence reporting to support the Bush administration's case for invading Iraq. By selectively presenting intelligence and suppressing contradictory evidence, WHIG prevented informed congressional deliberation on war authorization.

sources.title: Report on the U.S. Intelligence Community's Prewar Intelligence Assessments on Iraq
Commission on the Intelligence Capabilities of the United States Regarding Weapons of Mass Destruction
CIA Intelligence Estimates on Iraq Weapons Program

significance: Deliberate withholding of contradictory intelligence prevented informed congressional deliberation on war authorization, violating the constitutional requirement for executive accountability to the legislative branch.
